author: Special Correspondent
text:
City police have arrested a functionary of the ruling All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) on charges of cheating several people of money after promising them jobs in private companies.

Police said Gopi of Tondiarpet had given Rs. 3 lakh to Balasubramani, the R.K. Nagar secretary of the party, in the hope of getting a job for his nephew. “Balasubramani claimed he knew many people in the industry. Recently, he showed Gopi an appointment order and demanded Rs. 2 lakh more,” an investigating policeman said.

Gopi later lodged a complaint at New Washermanpet police station. “We found that he had cheated many people in a similar fashion,” said a poiceman. He has been remanded in judicial custody. Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Tuesday expelled Balasubramani from the party.
title: Job racket: AIADMK functionary arrested
